observations: The Active Directory Authentication code exists in the codebase at: Evoq Platform/Providers/AuthenticationProviders/DotNetNuke.Authentication.ActiveDirectory/
The code includes Login.ascx (UI), Login.ascx.cs (code-behind), and AuthenticationController.cs (authentication logic)

The code shows the AD login form has: Username field with RequiredFieldValidator, RegularExpressionValidator (rejects asterisks), Password field with RequiredFieldValidator, CAPTCHA support (controlled by Security_CaptchaLogin setting), Login button with AD_Auth validation group
The code supports both DOMAIN\username and username@domain formats, with automatic conversion to standard format
The code supports default domain prefix functionality when configured
The Authentication module exists in the Modules list (version 9.3.2) but shows 'In Use: No'
The Authentication Systems extension list only shows 'Default Authentication' - the AD provider package is not installed
Available Extensions for Authentication Systems do not include Active Directory (only Facebook, Google, Live, Twitter are available)
The login page does not show any AD/Windows authentication tab because the provider is not installed/enabled
To test this feature, the DotNetNuke.Authentication.ActiveDirectory provider would need to be installed as an authentication system extension
